sentences: Me olemes saadetud teated vastu v√µtnud.
context: Saatnud is the past tense, partitive form of the Estonian verb 'saata' which means 'to send'. It specifically refers to having completed the action of sending something in the past. The word follows Estonian grammar rules where it's formed by adding -tud suffix to the stem saat- and used with a direct object in the partitive case.
